instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1502 820-4924-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an A1502 820-4924-A with no power.

I have green light and the the bench PSU pulls 80mA with the board only on the bench.

On PP3V42_G3H I only get 3.390V. Can it be that?

threads.title: A1502 820-4924-A no power
threads.message:
That is good enough voltage.

Did you check other voltages and signals from power on sequence?

threads.title: A1502 820-4924-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

PPBUS_G3H = 12.58V
PP5V_S5 = 5V
PP5V_S4 = 0V
PP3V3_S5 = 1.2V
PP3V3_SUS = 0V
PP3V3SUS_EN=0V
PM_SLP_S5_L=0V
PM_SLP_SUS_L=0V
PPBUS_S4_X239 = 0V

threads.title: A1502 820-4924-A no power
threads.message:
"PP3V3_S5 = 1.2V"
Machine doesn't achieve S5 state even.
Check SMC_PM_G2_EN first.
Post U7501 basic voltages; pins 23, 22, 12, 13, 29, 21.

threads.title: A1502 820-4924-A no power
threads.message:
Looks like SMC problem; may need to change it.
Check diode mode to ground at 3V42_G3H; in both directions.

threads.title: A1502 820-4924-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

Diode readings on 3V42_G3H:
0.328
1.370

I already replaced SMC. Shall I replace it for another one?

threads.title: A1502 820-4924-A no power
threads.message:
Readings look good.
Try known good SMC, just to discard it.

threads.title: A1502 820-4924-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I've tried 2 new SMC but still no power. However, now I get this readings on U7501 pins:

12 = 3.4V
13 = 1.995V
21 = 3.4V

threads.title: A1502 820-4924-A no power
threads.message:
So you get correct SMC_PM_G2_EN now.

What about 3V3_S5/SUS and other power on signals?

threads.title: A1502 820-4924-A no power
threads.message:
HI,

Yes, now I have 3.3V on 3V3_S5/SUS

PP3V42_G3H = 3.4V
PP5V_S5 = 5V
PP5V_S4 = 0V
PP3V3_S4 = 0V

PPBUS_S4_X239 = 0V

The only thing that gets hot is U7100, but I think that it has nothing to do with it.

threads.title: A1502 820-4924-A no power
threads.message: Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L (at same time).

threads.title: A1502 820-4924-A no power
threads.message: Yes,  I do have a pulse on  PM_SLP_S4_L

threads.title: A1502 820-4924-A no power
threads.message:
Check for pulse at all big coils.
Also check ALL_SYS_PWRGD and PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: A1502 820-4924-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

Sorry for the late reply.

Hi only get a pulse on L7520 and on L7630.

ALL_SYS_PWRGD = 3.3V

PLT_RESET_L = 0V

threads.title: A1502 820-4924-A no power
threads.message:
"ALL_SYS_PWRGD = 3.3V"
Do you mean steady voltage?
If yes, then must get steady voltage at L7520, L7430, L7630, and L7820/70 too.
In case of a pulse only, all mentioned coils should pulse too.

Try starting in SMC bypass mode.
